cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi SSW of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north and forecast to turn north-northeast toward central and northern Baja California, then into the Desert Southwest of the United States

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect; a tropical-storm watch may be issued later for western Baja California (Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Most of the Baja California Peninsula, parts of north-western Sonora, Arizona, and the southern California coastline (high surf/rip currents)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy to windy conditions with occasional gusts possible late Monday into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along San Diego’s coast, though elevated surf and long-period swells will affect the harbor entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday–Tuesday as Rosa’s moisture moves over southern California, with localized heavier bursts
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning over the weekend could hamper small-craft operations and pier/terminal activities
